revised_title: Experiments on Combinations of Fluoric Acid and Fluoboracic Acid
tldr: The author, John Davy, conducted experiments on different combinations of fluoric acid and fluoboracic acid. He studied silicated fluoric acid gas, subsilicated fluoric acid, and their combinations with ammonia. He also discovered fluoboracic acid and its compounds with ammonia. The experiments provided insights into the properties and reactions of these compounds, including their densities, solubility in water, and interactions with other substances.
